Those actually desirous of performing Haribhajana but in whose heart the weeds of material desires grow and were unable to give up excessive attachment of their wife and children should always try to hear from pure devotees and chant Hare Krishna and perform congregational chanting.
Instead of leaving their family and going away to a secluded place, one should actually engage in such activities even while remaining in family life.
In this way they can quickly become detached from the inclination to enjoy materially.
Then they will gradually realize that if one completely surrenders to Krishna,
then one will attain all the qualities of life.
As long as one remains in bodily consciousness, one cannot obtain the mercy of Krishna.
So in this way, Gaur Kishore das Babaji Maharaj taught what is real renunciation because he himself was a real renunciate.
Then regarding his passing away, on November 16, 1915,
Gaur Kishore das Babaji Maharaj entered the eternal pastimes of the Lord, Nitya Leela Pravishta.
That means he passed away from this world.
That day at sunrise, his disciple Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati Thakur
left Sri Mayapur for the place where Srila Bhaktisiddhanta, sorry,
Gaur Kishore das Babaji Maharaj had been staying in a place at Kuliyam.
The head priest of Navadvipa's various temples and ashrams began to argue
where would Babaji Maharaj's samadhi be made, the actual place.
So there was a heated argument among so many different people.
So because there was a material motive, whoever got the opportunity to prepare the samadhi of this great Paramahamsa,
Srila Gaur Kishore das Babaji Maharaj,
they would have huge number of people visit their temple and get handsomely from the pilgrims.
So with this material motive, there was so much of argument.
So Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati Thakur could understand their material motive
and he wanted to actually stop them from simply creating a controversy.
Now, not only Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati Thakur wanted to avoid the controversy,
but even the Navadvipa's inspector of police, whose name was Jathindra Sinha at that time,
he arrived at that place apprehending some breach of peace.
So after much discussions, the other Vaishnavas who were running different ashrams and mats,
they stated their position to the inspector.
That Saraswati Thakur is not a sannyasi.
He has no right to prepare a samadhi for a person who is completely renounced.
Hearing their pronouncement, Saraswati Thakur replied in a voice like thunder,
I am the sole disciple of Paramahamsa Srila Gaurakeshwara das Babaji Maharaj.
Even though I have not accepted sannyas, I am a celibate brahmachari
and by the grace of Babaji Maharaj, I am not hypocritical, renunciant, addicted to abominable habits.
So he put a challenge for those people who within the last one year or six months or three months
or just even one month or even three days has not indulged in illicit association with women
will be able to touch the spiritually blissful body of Srila Gaurakeshwara das Babaji Maharaj.
If anyone else touches the body, he will be completely ruined.
Hearing these words, the inspector of police asked Srila Saraswati Thakur,
How will evidence for this be produced?
So Saraswati Thakur replied, I will believe whatever they say.
Let them just tell it. That's all.
After this challenge is offered, all the other Babaji's,
they turned their backs and went away one by one.
That means they all accepted that they were not leading a pure life.
Then, Srila Bhaktisiddhan Saraswati Thakur actually prepared a nice samadhi
and laid to rest the blissful transcendental body of Srila Gaurakeshwara das Babaji Maharaj.
So let us end this presentation with the prayer to Srila Gaurakeshwara das Babaji Maharaj.
Namo Gaurakeshwaraya Sakshad Vairagya Murtaye Vipralambhara Sambhode Padambhu Jayate Namaha
The meaning is, I offer my respectful obeisances unto Srila Gaurakeshwara das Babaji Maharaj,
the spiritual master of Srila Bhaktisiddhan Saraswati Thakur,
whose renunciation personified Sakshad Vairagya Murti,
he is always merged in a feeling of separation from an intense love of Krishna.
